title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 December 2013 - XWiki
content:
<mflorea> has quit  
00:08 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

08:36 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki

10:01 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <sburjan> good morning vmassol, tmortagne. I see there is no new snapshot today, should we use the last from yesterday ?  
10:03 <tmortagne> sburjan: if you look at jenkins you will see that platform build is failing, that's why you XE hasn't been built automatically  
10:03 <tmortagne> s/you//  
10:04 <tmortagne> you can force a XE build if you want  
10:04 <sburjan> it's useless, since the bugs we are chasing are on platform  
10:06 <tmortagne> sburjan: are the bugs you are talking about been committed ?  
10:06 <tmortagne> platform has failing tests, does not means it's unusable  
10:06 <tmortagne> most failing test are failing because of the tests themself  
10:06 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
10:12 <vmassol> trying again to fix the functional tests now  
10:12 <vmassol> (I didn't succeed yesterday)  
10:19 <lucaa> has quit  
10:21 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <msmeria> vmassol: can you give me the right to trigger a build on ci.xwiki.org ? my username is msmeria  
10:34 <vmassol> I can trigger it for you if you want  
10:34 <msmeria> ok  
10:34 <vmassol> but it might not be enough  
10:34 <vmassol> let me check  
10:35 <vmassol> I hope it's enough, not 100% sure  
10:35 <vmassol> anyway I've triggerd enterprise  
10:35 <msmeria> merci  
10:36 <vmassol> strange, getting some local build failure:  
10:36 <vmassol> Could not find artifact org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-oldcore:jar:5.3-SNAPSHOT  
10:37 <vmassol> there are some snaps though: http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-oldcore/5.3-SNAPSHOT/  
10:37 <vmassol> running it a second time works… weird  
10:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> oh just realized our build fails with maven 3.1.1  
10:47 <vmassol> our packager plugin isn't compatible  
10:48 <sburjan> has quit  
10:48 <vmassol> going to doc this  
10:49 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <vmassol> (just created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9760 too)  
10:57 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <msmeria> tmortagne: I still get "XWiki Solr index thread" errors when migrating from 5.2.1 to the latest snapshot: xwiki-enterprise-web-5.3-20131203.094059-146.war  
11:13 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: said you fixed those yesterday  
11:14 <tmortagne> msmeria: I did  
11:15 <vmassol> fixing UserDirectoryTest  
11:16 <msmeria> tmortagne: I don't see any difference from yesterday's build regarding these errors...  
11:17 <tmortagne> msmeria: could you paste your exact errors  
11:17 <msmeria> sure  
11:20 <msmeria> tmortagne: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-iHL52ujhxKMU5kQmF6WjVuMlk/edit?usp=sharing  
11:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think you did the opposite to what you wanted, fixing :)  
11:23 <tmortagne> msmeria: completely different error  
11:23 <vmassol> ah no  
11:23 <tmortagne> I would bet a a change made by mflorea in the solr shema which make the 5.2.1 solr index incompatible and we don't have any automatic migration for it  
11:24 <tmortagne> mflorea ?  
11:24 <mflorea> tmortagne: I don't think I changed anything for 5.2.1, I'm only working on master  
11:25 <tmortagne> mflorea: msmeria is doing 5.2.1 to 5.3 migration tests  
11:25 <mflorea> ah, then of course  
11:25 <mflorea> he needs to remove the /data/solr folder  
11:25 <tmortagne> I meant that the current shecma is i compatible with 5.2.1 one  
11:25 <mflorea> yep  
11:25 <tmortagne> s/shecma/schema/  
11:25 <tmortagne> this is a bit of a pain  
11:26 <tmortagne> but it's not easy to upgrade solr  
11:26 <sburjan> this is the second time this happens  
11:26 <tmortagne> sburjan: probably not the last time  
11:26 <vmassol> mflorea: is this documented clearly in RN? (People will have issues with this even with the doc but at least it's better than nothing)  
11:27 <vmassol> tmortagne: in that case we might want to have some migration to delete the solr directory?  
11:27 <vmassol> (should be an easy one to write)  
11:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: you mean use database migration to delete something in permdir ?  
11:28 <mflorea> vmassol: RN for 5.3RC1 is a work in progress, it will contain the right info in the end.  
11:28 <vmassol> yes  
11:29 <tmortagne> mflorea: sure but having to delete the index before upgrading is not very nice  
11:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: problem is that SOLR is started et running before that AFAIK  
11:30 <vmassol> hmm right…  
11:30 <tmortagne> we could have a distribution status based migration system executed at application startup  
11:31 <msmeria> I've also got this at the end of the migration: http://hastebin.com/pumavahipo.avrasm  
11:31 <mflorea> tmortagne: it's not that difficult either, and it's not my focus currently.  
11:32 <vmassol> what's your focus mflorea?  
11:33 <mflorea> vmassol http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/WebHome  
11:34 <vmassol> the 5 remaining issues?  
11:34 <vmassol> how long do you need before we can release RC? Or do you want to have them in a RC2 or final? (final is bit risky no?)  
11:34 <tmortagne> mflorea: it's not much about being difficult but people will never think about it (yes I know it's in the RN but it's not in the upgrade documentation or anything like this), and yes it's not your fault but it still worth thinking about possible solutions  
11:35 <mflorea> vmassol: 4 actually, I moved XWIKI-9528 for later since we depend on Tika 1.5 release. And I'm about to close another one soon, so 3 left.  
11:36 <mflorea> vmassol: as I said friday, I'm fine with fixing them for 5.3 final  
11:36 <mflorea> (the remaining 3)  
11:36 <jtafurth|away> has quit  
11:36 <vmassol> mflorea: this means they won't be tested, is that ok?  
11:37 <vmassol> (I mean tested by others)  
11:37 <mflorea> tmortagne: I agree, but as I said, implementing some migration mechanism for solr is not on the roadmap currently.  
11:38 <mflorea> vmassol: isn't 5.3 final going to be tested?  
11:38 <vmassol> no  
11:38 <vmassol> we never do  
11:38 <vmassol> only RC gets tested  
11:38 <mflorea> ok, then no tests  
11:38 <vmassol> and the final is tested \*after\* it's released  
11:38 <mflorea> if that is the policy  
11:38 <vmassol> ie  toom ate  
11:38 <vmassol> too late  
11:39 <vmassol> seen what remains I think we might either want ot delay RC1 or do a RC2  
11:39 <vmassol> I'm also not 100% confident with the wiki integration  
11:39 <mflorea> vmassol: is all work on wikis done at this point?  
11:39 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: what's your status?  
11:39 <mflorea> I mean all work planned for 5.3RC1  
11:39 <gdelhumeau> I am finishing a new migration about the searchsuggest config  
11:40 <tmortagne> what's left is mostly dealing with workspaces hacks vs 3 ways merge, right gdelhumeau ?  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> yes  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> actually I'm writing tests for that  
11:41 <tmortagne> not really planned stuff, more stuff discovered while testing migrations  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> instructions covered ratio is 0.88  
11:42 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: there's a problem on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/WebHome  
11:42 <vmassol> you have only 1 issue listed  
11:42 <gdelhumeau> weird  
11:42 <gdelhumeau> on JIRA my filter still works  
11:42 <vmassol> labels = roadmap53 AND component IN ("Wiki")  
11:43 <vmassol> don't you also need the other components btw?  
11:43 <vmassol> workspaces and wiki manager?  
11:43 <vmassol> can you fix it?  
11:43 <vmassol> thanks  
11:44 <vmassol> wrong name  
11:44 <vmassol> :)  
11:44 <vmassol> {Unused} Workspaces  
11:44 <vmassol> {Unused} Wiki Manager  
11:44 <gdelhumeau> or I can chaneg the filter to my "affected to gdelhumeau"  
11:45 <vmassol> well the issue with this is for issues that are assigned  
11:45 <vmassol> they won't show up  
11:45 <vmassol> what we could do  
11:45 <vmassol> is just have a roadmap53 label  
11:45 <vmassol> and display them all in a single table  
11:46 <vmassol> + keep the ones we choose to do in addition of roadmap53  
11:46 <vmassol> anyway for now let's keep it like this  
11:46 <vmassol> we'll imprvoe for the next roadmaps  
11:47 <vmassol> so all closed :)  
11:47 <vmassol> so you have no more work!  
11:47 <vmassol> is that normal?  
11:47 <gdelhumeau> yes, the migration issue is not reported on jira  
11:47 <gdelhumeau> or I can reopen something  
11:47 <vmassol> reopen is better if jira is not already released  
11:48 <gdelhumeau> I can put the label roadmap53 to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9738  
11:49 <gdelhumeau> or I should change the jira filter to manually add it  
11:49 <vmassol> yes better not add roadmap53  
11:49 <vmassol> since this is what was decided at the beginning of the release with everyone  
11:50 <vmassol> no need to add all issues done in the roadmap  
11:50 <vmassol> it should onyl contain what was planned to do  
11:50 <vmassol> what is done can be found in the RN  
11:58 <camil7> has left #xwiki  
12:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
12:19 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <vmassol> ok I can reproduce the issue for AdministrationTest locally, debugging  
12:22 <vmassol> oh… the Xwiki space isn't listed! )  
12:22 <vmassol> :)  
12:23 <vmassol> ah I know  
12:23 <vmassol> that's fun  
12:24 <vmassol> the superadmin user doesn't display hidden docs by default (I think that's wrong BTW) and since we didn't import the XWiki.Admin page (which is not hidden) there's no non hiddne doc in the xwiki space  
12:24 <vmassol> and it's not listed  
12:24 <vmassol> (which is yet another bug I think)  
12:24 <vmassol> I'll file 2 jiras...  
12:36 <lucaa> has quit  
12:37 <msmeria> tmortagne: I still don't get the DW when I create a subwiki after a migration  
12:39 <msmeria> in the Administration page I get: "Your wiki seems empty. You may want to import the default XWiki Enterprise wiki which contains a set of useful pages: user profiles, recent activity, administration pages and many more. This wiki is distributed as a XAR file, you can download it fromhttp://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/5.3-SNAPSHOT/.", but there's no 5.3-SNAPSHOT folder on http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/ente  
12:45 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
12:48 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
12:58 <vmassol> ok I should have fixed all func tests now, let's see...  
12:58 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: the wiki index issue is fixed, but there are still some issues with subwikis  
12:59 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <msmeria> the title is still "$wikiDescriptor.wikiName", and the Wiki Information panel has some bugs: http://s12.postimg.org/phcpt99y5/panel.png  
12:59 <msmeria> the button should be Join  
13:00 <msmeria> and the key above should be also translated  
13:05 <msmeria> the keys are: "WikiManager.WikiCandidateMemberClass\_membershipType\_invite" and "WikiManager.WikiCandidateMemberClass\_membershipType\_open", but I can't find them on l10n  
13:05 <msmeria> maybe that's the issue  
13:12 <gdelhumeau> it's a new subwiki?  
13:12 <gdelhumeau> created with the snapshot?  
13:14 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: yes  
13:15 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: no. sorry. for new ones I don't even have an UI. it's an oild one migrated from 5.2.1  
13:15 <msmeria> \*old  
13:15 <gdelhumeau> ok  
13:15 <gdelhumeau> you had the DW ?  
13:15 <msmeria> no, because I choose upgrade all wikis in DW  
13:15 <msmeria> when migrating  
13:16 <gdelhumeau> and you have upgraded that subwiki just affter clicking on "upgrade all"?  
13:16 <msmeria> ytes  
13:17 <gdelhumeau> ok so it should be upgraded then  
13:17 <mflorea> has quit  
13:18 <gdelhumeau> so I don't understand how the title could be this one...  
13:18 <msmeria> it is upgraded for the most part, just the title and panel are buggy  
13:18 <msmeria> I had a merge conflict on Main.WebHome  
13:18 <msmeria> same as the one from yesterday  
13:18 <gdelhumeau> ok so it has keeped the old title, that can't work anymore  
13:19 <msmeria> in edit mode, the title is: "#set($wikiDescriptor = $services.wikimanager.getWikiDocument($xcontext.database))#{if}("$!wikiDescriptor.getValue('wikiprettyname')" != '')$wikiDescriptor.getValue('wikiprettyname')#{else}$wikiDescriptor.wikiName#{end}"  
13:29 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
13:32 <sburjan> tmortagne: I still don't get the DW when using Tomcat + Postgres :| I'll start again with today's snapshot. This is annoying me already  
13:33 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: another thing: if I create an old-style subwiki (local users) on 5.2.1, I don't have any link that points to the main wiki  
13:35 <tmortagne> msmeria: that's the point of old-style wiki, more or less isolated wiki  
13:37 <tmortagne> sburjan: what build did you tried with ?  
13:37 <sburjan> I tried with what was available this morning:  xwiki-enterprise-web-5.3-20131202.124255-145.war      02-Dec-2013 13:43  166M  
13:37 <sburjan> now trying with the latest build  
13:38 <tmortagne> sburjan: I committed the fix one hour after this build date  
13:38 <sburjan> the fix about DW ? I remember you committed it yesterday  
13:38 <sburjan> the fact that DW does not kick in. The race condition issue  
13:38 <tmortagne> as I said this morning XE does not build automatically at all because of failing test in platform so you have to force it when you want a new one  
13:39 <sburjan> ok  
13:39 <tmortagne> sburjan: 02-Dec-2013 13:43 is yesterday  
13:39 <tmortagne> and it's 1h before my commit  
13:39 <sburjan> I  see  
13:40 <tmortagne> please try to make sure what you are testing with since otherwise you are going to be annoyed for a long time...  
13:41 <sburjan> I am already aannoyed  
13:41 <msmeria> tmortagne: shouldn't I always get "XWiki Enterprise - UI - Common" when creating an old style subwiki ?  
13:41 <sburjan> this thpe of testing is not fun :)  
13:41 <msmeria> without a template  
13:41 <tmortagne> msmeria: in 5.3 ?  
13:41 <msmeria> 5.2.1  
13:43 <tmortagne> msmeria: only if you create it before standard template, this is a bug of the UI matching the ui-all installed on the previously created template  
13:43 <tmortagne> this is fixed in 5.3  
13:43 <msmeria> I see  
13:43 <tmortagne> XWIKI-9589  
13:43 <tmortagne> that's the issue  
13:43 <sburjan> tmortagne: shouldn't this be fixed 5.2.2 ?  
13:44 <tmortagne> it imply some dangerous API changes and was not really seen as an important blocker  
14:03 <vmassol> ok going to really fix the 2 functional tests in a few minutes!  
14:18 <vmassol> this time I'm confident platform build is going to pass :)  
14:19 <vmassol> just 2 hours to wait… :(  
14:20 <cjd> Oh, the new cjdns build runs in 10 seconds for a clean build w/ tests, 20 seconds if it needs to build it's dependencies as well  
14:20 <cjd> ofc it's all written in node.js  
14:21 <cjd> 45k LoC for cjdns itself, the dependencies I'm not sure  
14:22 <vmassol> cjd: why don't you come help us on the xwiki project to reduce build times? :)  
14:23 <cjd> because if you saw my build code you would cringe :)  
14:23 <cjd> it's not ready for prime time just yet  
14:24 <vmassol> if you reinvent a build system, indeed that's a problem, it's not the goal of the xwiki project to do that  
14:24 <cjd> I don't think it's really possible to get fast builds doing everything sequencially  
14:25 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:26 <cjd> but my build system is likely to eventually support building java code and probably handle a reasonable subset of maven xmhell so it will be a possibility When It's Done(tm)  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> Denis: I have splitted  my migrator in 2 migrators  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> but only one of them is executed  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> any clue?  
14:40 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: same hint ?  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: no  
14:40 <vmassol> DB version  
14:40 <vmassol> probably  
14:40 <tmortagne> that too  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: at first yes, but then I changed it with no success  
14:41 <tmortagne> component.txt ?  
14:41 <gdelhumeau> good  
14:41 <vmassol> :)  
14:42 <Denis> :)  
14:42 <gdelhumeau> (btw, there is still the solr stack trace when I save a document in a migrator)  
14:42 <gdelhumeau> I said good as "it is good"  
14:42 <gdelhumeau> I mean the problems does not come from component.txt  
14:42 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: re solr this is different than before  
14:42 <Denis> ah, well, do you have implemented shouldExecute() ?  
14:43 <tmortagne> the solr schema changed  
14:43 <tmortagne> so you need to delete it before migrate  
14:43 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: ah yes: org.apache.solr.common.SolrException: ERROR: [doc=xwiki:Scheduler.WatchListDailyNotifier\_] multiple values encountered for non multiValued field class: [XWiki.SchedulerJobClass, XWiki.WatchListJobClass, XWiki.XWikiRights]  
14:43 <vmassol> we need another migration or something else to clean the solr schema, see discussion above gdelhumeau  
14:44 <gdelhumeau> Denis: no, I already have it in AbstractHibernateDataMigration  
14:44 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: ok, sorry :/  
14:44 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you can debug re your migration problem  
14:45 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you sure you have both modules in the classpath ?  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> ok found it  
14:48 <gdelhumeau> WEB-INF/components.txt instead of META-INF/components.txt -\_-  
14:48 <vmassol> nice  
14:56 <OSIMasson> has quit  
15:17 <msmeria> has quit  
15:21 <UCC> has quit  
15:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:30 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
16:23 <lucaa> has quit  
16:34 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
16:44 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:53 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
17:09 <msmeria> has quit  
17:11 <vrachieru> has quit  
17:13 <dpatriche> has quit  
17:15 <camil7> has left #xwiki  
17:21 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
17:48 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:54 <gdelhumeau> I have fixed my last issues  
17:54 <gdelhumeau> there are PR for that  
17:54 <gdelhumeau> except that we have a problem, DW is not able to properly merge the title of Main.WebHome of a workspace  
17:59 <UCC> has quit  
18:17 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: that rings a bell  
18:17 <vmassol> I remember seeing this issue before  
18:17 <vmassol> (about merging a title)  
18:17 <vmassol> tmortagne:  do you remember?  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> we know why  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> WorkspaceManager.Install did install the workspace-template-features XAR  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> which has its own Main.WebHome  
18:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: we talked about it already  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> but the XAR is not registred in EM  
18:18 <vmassol> ah yes I rememebr niw  
18:18 <vmassol> it's about char merge vs line merge  
18:19 <tmortagne> from EM point of view the previous version is XE standard home page, not workspace one  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> so when we upgrade, DW does not recognize the new Main.WebHome and it sees it as a manual modification  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> so there is a conflict  
18:19 <tmortagne> vmassol: what you remember is a bug that made it merge the page without any conflict, he you do get a conflict since the bug is fixed
